p: In silico tools were also used to screen potential larvicides and insecticides to control vector species (Dhananjeyan et al., 2009; Oliferenko et al., 2013; da Silva et al., 2015; Canizares-Carmenate et al., 2017; Silva et al., 2017) and to model vector dynamics or transmission patterns considering the effect of vector genetic manipulation strategies (Atkinson et al., 2007; Huang et al., 2007; Rasgon, 2009; Okamoto et al., 2013), vector infection with Wolbachia, an endosymbiotic bacteria that prevents viral transmission (Zhang X. et al., 2016; Xue et al., 2017), vector control chemicals, such as larvicides and insecticides (Hu et al., 2009; Oki et al., 2011; Pawelek et al., 2014) or the use of vector control chemicals along with other strategies, such as the destruction of mosquito breeding sites (Amaku et al., 2014).
